intro: Triticum ispahanicum, commonly known as Persian wheat, is a species of wheat native to the highlands of Iran. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and spike-like inflorescence. The plant produces small,颖果-like grains that are typically harvested for their nutritional value. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its historical significance and unique genetic makeup, it is of interest to botanists and agricultural researchers.
